children.name: Text
children.value: You and your old pal Aarhant are living it easy, but a fateful letter from your sister Hannah means a sudden return to the old world. Since you are too poor to afford passage, you must earn it by fishing.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Fetch [AssetData(102487) Text] from:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ItemPlace]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value:
Use [AssetData(102487) Text] on:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]

children.name: Text
children.value:
Pick up:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant can't believe you want to pay the passage home by dynamite fishing.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant says the dynamite you need is in the derelict lighthouse.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant hands you the dynamite nervously.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant thinks you have enough fish to pay for a ticket home.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant points you to the shack in the harbour for your ticket.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant is unimpressed by your aim.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant is impressed by your aim.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant reminds you to catch fish so you can buy your passage back home.

children.name: Text
children.value: Select the dynamite from your ship and try to hit the fish swarm floating near your ship. To make a direct hit you will have to anticipate the swarm's speed and direction.

children.name: Text
children.value: Once you have all fish on your ship, move your ship close to the shack on the coast to exchange them for a travel ticket to the Old World.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your friend Aarhant thinks on the past and the present.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant wonders what else you may have hidden about your past.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hard to read because of all the tear stains.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Grumpy Ticket Agent agrees to take your fish.

children.name: Text
children.value: The man gives you the ticket you need to return home in exchange.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Grumpy Ticket Agent wishes you'd hurry up and leave.

children.name: Text
children.value: Bring [Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ExecutionObject]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: The Grumpy Ticket Agent jumps in his seat because of the loud explosion.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Grumpy Ticket Agent wonders what you will try to sell him.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sell more of your sensational schooners:

children.name: Text
children.value: It may seem odd, but our next step is to sell this ship - it will show we mean to run an enterprise just as influential as father's.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sail schooner to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text], select it and sell it

children.name: Text
children.value: In the wake of your father's alleged treason and death, your uncle Edvard seized control of Goode & Sons, leaving you and your sister Hannah to fend for yourselves. Hannah has put everything into a small island, but it's in a bad state; the ruins of a tin rush litter the place. Before you can start afresh, you will need to demolish them.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Clear:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah encourages you to get to work on your new island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asks you to clear the first ruin to discover the island's potential.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is pleased with your work and encourages you to continue.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you there is forestry work to be done on your island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah mentions the small ruins on the island from which to get timber.

children.name: Text
children.value: Clear any small ruin for Timber

children.name: Text
children.value: Remove the old ruins to clear the area for the new buildings.

children.name: Text
children.value: You can also remove smaller ruins to get additional timber.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah noticed that you are running low on timber, but she knows a quick way to stock up on it. It so happens that there are still several ruins scattered around Ditchwater that you could demolish for materials.

children.name: Text
children.value: The island Hannah bought for the both of you. Ditchwater is still a diamond in the rough; the ruins of a tin rush town must be demolished and cleared before the potential Hannah saw in this place can be realised.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah prompts you to keep on cleaning the island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Remove the old market ruins to have more space for your village to grow.

children.name: Text
children.value: You can also remove smaller ruins to get additional timber.

children.name: Text
children.value: Ditchwater has almost become the haven Hannah dreamed it would be for the both of you. Only a few more ruins stand now in the way of building a shipping company worthy of your father's legacy.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah advises you to demolish the next ruins blocking your expansion.

children.name: Text
children.value: Remove the desolated church to have more space for your village to grow.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard is baffled that you would remain beyond the funeral proceedings.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah feels this island has potential.

children.name: Text
children.value: In the wake of your father's alleged treason and death, your uncle Edvard seized control of Goode & Sons, leaving you and your sister Hannah to fend for yourselves. You have your own company now, but there is plenty to do before you can think of ships and a shipyard. First, you will need to build a small settlement to house the loyal people who followed you and Hannah to Ditchwater.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asks that as a first step, you provide housing for your loyal followers.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah emphasises the importance of having more people to clear the island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to provide housing for your followers.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is glad you are managing to produce timber already.

children.name: Text
children.value: To attract farmers you need to build farmer residences.

children.name: Text
children.value: You farmers need to live close to a marketplace, build one near their residences.

children.name: Text
children.value: Uncle Edvard seized control of Goode & Sons and left you and your sister Hannah fending for yourselves. But you have your own company now, keeping your father's dreams alive. Still, there is plenty to do, before you can think of ships and a shipyard. Producing timber, for example.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah wants you to start producing timber.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to start producing timber.

children.name: Text
children.value: Now that Uncle Edvard has seized control of Goode & Sons, you have to start your own company from scratch. Still, there is plenty to do before you can think of ships and a shipyard. Clearing the ruins on Ditchwater took a lot of effort, and your people are hungry! The town needs a stable supply of food!

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah urges you to supply food to your farmers, tired from the demolition.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah urges you to feed your farmers.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aside from building residences for them, you need to provide for your residents' needs to attract more of them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build a fishery close to your Trading Post to provide fish to your farmers.

children.name: Text
children.value: You are keeping your father’s dream alive, as he always hoped you would. Still, there is plenty to do before you can think of ships and a shipyard. Housing your people, for example.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asks that you support the influx of settlers with housing and amenities.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to give your people the houses and amenities they need.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah congratulates you on building a settlement that may soon attract workers.

children.name: Text
children.value: One of your cousins writes from Bright Sands, the island now owned by your Uncle. He speaks of a climate of instability surrounding Edvard's administration. Find him in the vicinity of the Great Exhibition foundations and he may be able to help you gather some followers among the rioters.

children.name: Text
children.value: Find your Cousin leading a mob in the vicinity of Edvard's Great Exhibition construction site

children.name: Text
children.value: Your cousin informs Hannah and you that workers are rioting in Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah says people in Bright Sands are unhappy with Edvard and urges you to seek out your cousin.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah urges you to contact your cousin about the worker riots in Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Go to Edvard's harbour south-west of your island. You can also click on the quest in quest tracker to move the camera to Edvard’s harbor.

children.name: Text
children.value: Find Edvard's church in the harbour district. It has a high bell tower. Your sister also remembers that your cousin's house has a purple roof and a campfire in the backyard.

children.name: Text
children.value: Having saved the unhappy workers from your Uncle Edvard’s regime, your town must grow to accommodate them. With suitable housing, more workers will soon flood into your settlement, giving you the manpower to build your first shipyard.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Upgrade to:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asks that you upgrade your houses to accommodate workers.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to upgrade your houses for workers.

children.name: Text
children.value: Fulfill all basic needs of a farmer residence to have the maximum number of inhabitants.

children.name: Text
children.value: Fully populated residences can be upgraded to the next level using the upgrade button.

children.name: Text
children.value: You finally have the workers on your side, but you will need many more of them before a shipyard can be built. Your city needs to grow if you want your company to become an attractive choice for workers.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah says you must have more workers before you can build a shipyard.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to expand your city and workers.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is pleased that you have enough people to build a shipyard.

children.name: Text
children.value: Get more Workers by upgrading more residences or by fulfilling more needs.

children.name: Text
children.value: You have cleaned most of the island, but a few stubborn ruins remain. Luckily, you now have workers living in your city. They are skilled enough to take care of them and aid you in the final phases of making Ditchwater the perfect place to grow your new company.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah advises you to remove the more robust ruins on the island.

children.name: Text
children.value: With your Uncle's debt finally behind you, you are now free to start your shipping company. Your first shipyard and ships will take you and your sister to the bright future that your father would have wanted for you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is excited to see your first shipyard built.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is desperate to see the shipyard you have worked so hard for.

children.name: Text
children.value: There is a whiff of salt on the breeze. With your first shipyard and ships, it will surely be a matter of time before you eclipse your ghastly Uncle.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is keen to see sails manufactured.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah thinks you should make sails a priority.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah discourages you from opening your Uncle’s private letter.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is shocked by Uncle Edvard’s letter and suggests you take it to Sir Archibald.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah has recognised Edvard's prisoners to be your father's most trusted associates, and the documents make it clear they may be wrongfully accused. Your sister believes a higher authority like Sir Archibald Blake ought to intervene in the matter.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah urges you go to Sir Archibald and show him Edvard’s devious letter.

children.name: Text
children.value:
OR:
Bring Edvard's Political Prisoners to Sir Archibald Blake

children.name: Text
children.value: If you decide to bring the political prisoners to Archibald Blake, move your ship close to his lighthouse.

children.name: Text
children.value: Workers will migrate into a city, not into a village. You need to expand your small town.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asks you to build housing for migrants.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you that new farmers need a proper housing.

children.name: Text
children.value: Since your Uncle Edvard doesn’t trust your father’s former newspaper editor, perhaps it is an opportunity for you to employ his services instead. Rumour has it he is a loyal fellow, even a little too loyal...

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant wonders if your father’s former newspaper editor would be willing to work with you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant reminds you to find the Editor in your Harbour.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant reminds you that people need a place to drink, rest and celebrate to recover from all the hard work after cleaning the ruins in Ditchwater. A bit of schnapps and a local pub should keep their spirits up.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant thinks Schnapps can motivate your people to keep going.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant reminds you to schnapp to it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Provide your farmers with schnapps to make your farmers happy. In order to do so build a potato farm and a schnapps distillery close to each other, and connect them to a nearby trading post or warehouse with a road. Build a pub close to your farmers' residences to make your farmers happier.

children.name: Text
children.value: You can also build more schnapps facilities to satisfy your farmers' needs faster.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant alerts you to an emergency lifeboat in your harbour. The survivors aboard are dressed in prison uniform, and no doubt have some tale to tell.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant alerts you to the arrival of an emergency lifeboat in your harbour.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant is sure the lifeboat survivors in your harbour are of interest.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Talk to:
Survivors on [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Object]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: You have rescued your Uncle's prisoners as they were being transported to Eli Bleakworth's prison, but they claim that Edvard has forged the charges against them. Aarhant has found some sealed documents amid the wreckage that may prove this, if you dare open them...

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant dares you to open your Uncle’s sealed letter.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant encourages you to oppose your uncle Edvard.

children.name: Text
children.value: If you decide to open the letter, you will find it in your ship.

children.name: Text
children.value: Eli wants Alwin, a former prisoner, found, so his investigation into your father's death can proceed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Eli Bleakworth invites you to investigate the circumstances of your father's death.

children.name: Text
children.value: Alwin admits it was he who killed your father, and made it look like something else.

children.name: Text
children.value: Eli is concerned the security of his prison is compromised, and will speak to you later.

children.name: Text
children.value: You delivered a letter to Eli Bleakworth, prison governor. There’s funny business between he and Edvard, of which you now are a part.

children.name: Text
children.value: The prison governor asks you to transport convicts to your Uncle’s island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Eli reminds you the delivery to Edvard is urgent.

children.name: Text
children.value: Eli Bleakworth asks if you are ready to hand over the prisoners.

children.name: Text
children.value: Although he now controls your father’s assets, Uncle Edvard is insisting you pay for your father’s funeral. Hannah is rightly furious, but hopes a supply of Schnapps will make him go away.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard reminds you of the debt you owe him for your father’s funeral costs.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard forces you to repay him.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard is impatient for the funeral payment.

children.name: Text

Have in storage:
[Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Uncle Edvard's ship is waiting in your harbour to pick up 4 tons of schnapps. You need to have at least 4 tons of schnapps in your island's storage to be able to repay Uncle Edvard's debt.

children.name: Text
children.value: It might help you repay the debt faster if you stop delivering schnapps to your farmers: Pause the consumption of schnapps in any farmer's residence building. Note that they won’t like it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard asks if you are ready to hand over the schnapps.

children.name: Text
children.value: Although he now controls your father's assets, Uncle Edvard is insisting you pay for your father's funeral. He is still not nearly satisfied and demands you deliver the next payment in work clothes.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard asks you to deliver Work Clothes as your second debt repayment.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard is impatient for the delivery of Work Clothes.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard is satisfied with your debt repayment, for now.

children.name: Text
children.value: Uncle Edvard's ship is waiting in your harbour to pick up 4 tons of clothes. You need to have at least 4 tons of clothes in your island's storage to be able to repay Uncle Edvard's debt.

children.name: Text
children.value: You could also repay the debt faster if you stop delivering clothes to your farmers: Pause the consumption of clothes in any farmer's residence building. They won't like it, however.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard asks if you are ready to hand over the clothes.

children.name: Text
children.value: Although he now controls your father’s assets, Uncle Edvard is insisting you pay for your father’s funeral. Sir Archibald Blake has informed you that your Uncle has registered this debt officially with the Queen, preventing you from acquiring a shipping license until it's settled. To make things worse, he is asking you pay him in sails, of all things.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard wants a third funeral repayment, this time in sails.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard sizzles with rage over the lateness of your third repayment.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard seems intent on making you his dogsbody.

children.name: Text
children.value: Uncle Edvard's ship is waiting in your harbour to pick up 4 tons of sails.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard asks if you are ready to hand over the sails.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard demands that you pick up the cargo from his shipwreck.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard's ship crashed near your shores and he demands you salvage the wreckage as the next errand in settling your debt to him.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Use a ship to resuce:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] from Prison Transport wreck

children.name: Text
children.value:
Use a ship to resuce:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] from Prison Transport wreck

children.name: Text
children.value: The Castaways were headed from Bright Sands to Wormways Prison Island. Search the sea to find them.

children.name: Text
children.value: You can click on the quest in the quest tracker to move the camera to the position where the castaways are located.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard offers to clear the debt if you deliver the men to prison.

children.name: Text
children.value: You have rescued your Uncle's prisoners from the shipwreck as they were being transported to Eli Bleakworth's prison. They claim to be entirely innocent, but your Uncle has promised to lift your debt if you complete their delivery to Eli...

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard is irritated you haven’t delivered his prisoners yet.

children.name: Text
children.value:
EITHER:
Bring Edvard's Political Prisoners to Eli Bleakworth

children.name: Text
children.value: If you have decided to do as Uncle Edvard asks, instead of opening his private letter, bring the political prisoners to Eli's prison. Uncle Edvard promised he might then clear your debt.

children.name: Text
children.value: Wormways Prison, Eli Bleakworth's prison island, is close to the Queen's representative Archibald Blake's island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake informed you that Uncle Edvard registered your funeral debt officially, preventing you from acquiring a shipping license until it is settled. It is unclear how or when will this be though, since your Uncle seems most reluctant to let you escape his service.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald reminds you that your outstanding debt prevents you from obtaining a shipyard license.

children.name: Text
children.value: Wait for Edvard to contact you about the debt to get your Shipping License

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake is curious to know what brings you here.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your cousin says Edvard’s workers are willing to jump ship for you.

children.name: Text
children.value: The people of Bright Sands are not at all happy with your Uncle's oppressive conditions and are willing to serve a fairer employer. Find the rioters and convince them to join your company.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Find:
Rioting Mobs [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] in Edvard's City

children.name: Text
children.value: Your cousin is wondering how to leave Edvard's island.

children.name: Text
children.value: A distant camera view (mouse wheel) is giving a better overview.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mobs have been observed around the foundation of the "World Fair".

children.name: Text
children.value: The Editor would like to use a photo of your shipyard for the newspaper.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Editor is impressed about the great composition of the photo.

children.name: Text
children.value: Finally, your first shipyard! What better news could you want for the first issue of your city newspaper? The Editor wants a picture of the shipyard, so that everyone in Ditchwater may see it.

children.name: Text
children.value: To take a picture of your sailing shipyard, start the photo mode by clicking on the photo button in the quest tracker.

children.name: Text
children.value: The shipyard has to be within the photography frame. You can use keyboard arrows to adjust your camera's position.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard's newspaper editor is also done with having to jeopardise his work in favor of your Uncle's twisted propaganda. He is glad to lend you a ship to take your new followers home, provided you employ him as well.

children.name: Text
children.value: The newspaper editor wants to leave Edvard as well, offering his ship for the passage.

children.name: Text
children.value: Select the Editor's ship at Edvard's Harbour

children.name: Text
children.value: Wait until the Editor arrives at your harbour

children.name: Text
children.value: Select the Editor and his crew at Edvard's Harbour

children.name: Text
children.value: It looks like there is someone in front of Edvard’s trading post who desperately wants to get your attention .

children.name: Text
children.value: Official licence legally enabling you to trade with other parties.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your father's former associates, who claim to have been wrongfully accused.

children.name: Text
children.value: An order assigned to Prison Governor Bleakworth to handout a "delivery".

children.name: Text
children.value: A group of men stranded at sea.

children.name: Text
children.value: It bears Uncle Edvard's seal. Should you open this private correspondence?

children.name: Text
children.value: Uncle Edvard wants to send political prisoners to Prison Governor Eli Bleakworth.

children.name: Text
children.value: Flotsam found at Edvard's wrecked prisoner transport ship.

children.name: Text
children.value: This ticket will get you home.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard thinks you are trying to undermine his business, and is embarrassed for you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard informs you that as Samuel’s heir, you must pay for his funeral.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is angry that Goode & Sons has not offered to foot the funeral bill.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah wants to show you the news from Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is shocked at Edvard's news and impact on your reputation.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Editor congratulates you on the publishing of your first news edition.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Editor starts to work on your newspaper.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Editor continues the work on your newspaper.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is outraged at your Uncle's abusive demands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is shocked that Edvard is asking for so much to pay for the funeral.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah doesn’t think Uncle Edvard will ever write off your debt.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mr. Sterling thanks you but seeks further guarantees of protection.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mr. Sterling accuses Edvard of falsely condemning innocents to prison.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant has discovered a sealed document from Uncle Edvard.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is delighted you now have clearance to build a shipyard.

children.name: Text
children.value: Eli Bleakworth thanks you for delivering Edvard’s prisoners.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard condescends to relieve you of your debt.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald duly awards you your long-awaited shipping licence.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Dear Governor Bleakworth,

More of the traitor Samuel’s conspirators. Crimes and sentences as follows;

Ernest Sterling – Use of foul language – 16 years with hard labour.
Verity Goodheart – Impersonation – Transportation to the Antipodes.
Elias Noble – Writing a threatening letter – Life imprisonment
Honora Decent – Character assassination – Life imprisonment
The judge saw very well my view, that any lack of proof they conspired with a traitor was, in itself, evidence they hide something. All things considered, his verdict could have been far worse. While I am under no obligation to explain such details, I thought that as a fellow dispenser of justice, the facts of the case may be of interest to you.

Sincerely
Edvard Goode
(Edvard) Goode & Sons Ltd.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah recognises the prisoners to be your father’s most trusted associates.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant thinks it obvious Uncle Edvard is trying to get rid of his critics.

children.name: Text
children.value: Do you really want to open the sealed document?

children.name: Text
children.value:
Dear Governor Bleakworth,

More of the traitor Samuel’s conspirators. Crimes and sentences as follows;

children.name: Text
children.value:
Ernest Sterling
Use of foul language – 16 years with hard labour

Verity Goodheart
Impersonation – Transportation to the Antipodes

Elias Noble
Writing a threatening letter – Life imprisonment

Honora Decent

children.name: Text
children.value:
The judge saw very well my view, that any lack of proof they conspired with a traitor was, in itself, evidence they hide something. All things considered, his verdict could have been far worse. While I am under no obligation to explain such details, I thought that as a fellow dispenser of justice, the facts of the case may be of interest to you.

Sincerely,

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald is disturbed to hear about Edvard's judicial practices and lifts your debt to him.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald writes off your debt and hands you your shipping licence.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard is furious that you snitched on him and Sir Archibald has written off your debt.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mr. Sterling thanks you for all you have done for him and the others.

children.name: Text
children.value: "I'm sure people would take more of our ships if they could. There can be little harm in trying!"

children.name: Text
children.value: Now that you have built your very first ship, you must sell it. Gathering new customers is the best way to increase your reputation and opportunities. The Queen's ambassador Sir Archibald Blake for example, may be interested...

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah advises you to trade with Madame Kahina for exotic goods instead.

children.name: Text
children.value: Madame Kahina can just offer you money now, but promises to bring a payment later.

children.name: Text
children.value:
OR:
Sail schooner to Madame Kahina, select it and sell it

children.name: Text
children.value: Industrialisation goes hand-in-hand with the production of steel, and the ships Sir Archibald Blake asked for need steel weapons. Hannah thinks the island she purchased has iron deposits, although they may be hard to reach. Your first task is to find them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asks you to find an iron mine so you can produce steel.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to find an iron mine to build the warships you need.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah regrets that the iron mine lies out of reach, and wonders if there is a solution.

children.name: Text
children.value: Contact the Prison Governor Eli Bleakworth

children.name: Text
children.value: Iron deposits have been located in the north-west of Ditchwater.

children.name: Text
children.value: Constructing a tunnel with the help of an expert is the only way for you to access iron mines.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah wants you to bail out a Demolitions Expert from prison and bring him home.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you about getting the Demolitions Expert.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah wants you to start the tunnel construction soon.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah congratulates you on enabling the industrialisation of your settlement.

children.name: Text
children.value: Pay the bail for the following specialist and bring him home:

children.name: Text
children.value: Socket Demolitions Expert at Headquarters to unlock iron mine:

children.name: Text
children.value: You have found a suitable weak spot in the mountain. But Hannah will not allow you to fool around with dynamite yourself. While you and the workers prepare the scaffolding on the mountain, your sister wants you to find your father's acquaintance specialized in demolitions. He is still living on Edvard’s island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is furious at Aarhant and you planning to set up the dynamite yourself.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah insists you find your father’s demolitions expert in Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you the demolitions expert lives somewhere in Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Search for:
Demolition Expert's explosives shop near Edvard's timber production

children.name: Text
children.value: The Demolition Expert's shop is located in the bleak area near Edvard's timber production.

children.name: Text
children.value: The roof of the shop is as red as the dynamite itself.

children.name: Text
children.value: The prisoners all look the same, but the Demolitions Expert is the best educated.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah encourages you to get things moving so the iron deposits can be reached. You should talk to the demolition expert and provide him with all the necessary details to get the job done. The demolition expert did not seem to take a liking to you and your sister. It makes Hannah wonder why, but she is glad he is willing to help us out.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah wants you give the newly-arrived demolition expert a warm welcome.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to brief the newly-arrived demolitions expert.

children.name: Text
children.value: Talk to the Demolition Expert waiting at your harbour

children.name: Text
children.value: The demolition expert Thomas N. Ticker questions the difference in working for you or Eli Bleakworth.

children.name: Text
children.value: Thomas N. Ticker disapproves of you trying to build a second Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your business partner Sir Archibald Blake emphasised the importance of military ships to Her Majesty at the current time, and that building merchant ships alone won't get you very far. Begin steel production now, so that you will be prepared to manufacture weapons in future.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah wants you to start producing steel to forge weapons for Archibald's commission.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to start producing steel.

children.name: Text
children.value: Establish steel production on your island

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake asks you to talk to Isabel Sarmento in The New World. To get there, Hannah believes you need a frigate— a ship better equipped to take on such a perilous expedition. Your people lack the knowledge to build such a ship, but if you were to attract artisans to your city, you'd have one built in no time.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah insists you build a frigate fit for the dangerous mission to the new world.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you a frigate is needed for your mission to the new world.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asserts the importance of producing the ships for Sir Archibald Blake, now that you have regained access to the iron deposits and can start producing steel. Making the Queen’s advisor a satisfied customer may be crucial in establishing a successful shipping company.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to produce weapons for the military ships that were ordered.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is motivated to start constructing the military ships for Sir Archibald Blake now.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is eager to look through father’s diary. Father was an astute man, and Hannah is convinced that by going over his notes, you will be able to learn something about those false accusations against him, and where this mysterious trail is leading.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is certain your father’s diary will explain everything.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah can hardly believe you would delay examining your father’s diary.

children.name: Text
children.value: Open Father's Diary on your ship

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is shocked and relieved to know that your father might have been manipulated.

children.name: Text
children.value: You learned from his diary, that your father was threatened by a cult behind the mysterious symbol. Hannah believes this symbol key to everything, and proposes taking the diary to a longtime friend of your father, Madame Kahina, whose extensive travels and social connections may yield answers.

children.name: Text
children.value: Deliver Your Father's Diary to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ExecutionObject]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah wonders if your father's diary contains any crucial information on your father's mystery.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to look into your father's diary.

children.name: Text
children.value: The New World and all its mysteries await you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah advises you to start the journey to the New World

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to go to the New World.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake explained that your father's island Prosperity was sold to a rebel leader in the New World named Isabel Sarmento. Since the deal was signed, Isabel has been in hiding, however. To get to the bottom of your father's case, you will need to find her. Hannah is excited to be going on such an expedition with you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah wants you to carefully plan the expedition to find Isabel Sarmento.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah hopes Isabel will be worth the effort it took to find her.

children.name: Text
children.value: To start the expedition, go to the World Map and select the New World Expedition.

children.name: Text
children.value: You may get your Demolitions Expert for the tunnel only once you help Eli investigate Edvard.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Prison Governor wants you to investigate on living conditions on Edvard's island.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Prison Governor reminds you about the investigation.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Prison Governor is surprised by Edvard's behavior and agrees to release your demolitions expert on bail.

children.name: Text
children.value: Take pictures (select banners) of the current situation on Edvard's island:

children.name: Text
children.value: Only a demolitions expert will enable you to complete the mountain excavation, and establish a safe connection to the iron mine.

children.name: Text
children.value: Eli Bleakworth doesn’t mind you taking this prisoner off his hands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Eli Bleakworth suggests you hurry and take your prisoner away.

children.name: Text
children.value: Command the Prison Governor’s ship to your island

children.name: Text
children.value: Wait until the Demolition Expert arrives at your harbour

children.name: Text
children.value: Eli Bleakworth asks if you can pay the bail of $5,000.

children.name: Text
children.value: Eli Bleakworth asks if you are ready to collect the Demolition Expert by ship and bring him to your island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant proposes to use the leftover dynamite to blow a hole in the mountain and gain access to those precious iron deposits. Look for a weak spot in the mountain.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant proposes blowing a way through to the iron deposit.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant reminds you the mountain must have a weak spot.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant thinks this abandoned mine entrance a good starting point.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant compliments you on your progress.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant is looking forward to the explosion.

children.name: Text
children.value: Complete the first phase of the excavation site

children.name: Text
children.value: Finish the last phase with the help of a Demolitions Expert

children.name: Text
children.value: Link the excavation site to a warehouse to support it with resources.

children.name: Text
children.value: By following the lead of Thomas Ticker, Aarhant found that your father’s murderer was hiding in a cave westwards. Aarhant wants you to attack the murderer’s ship and confront him, in an attempt to reveal the truth about what really happened to your father. Aarhant stresses that you not let the murderer get away!

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant urges you to attack the ship.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant presses you to act quickly if you are to avenge your father.

children.name: Text
children.value: Keep moving to avoid damage from the flame-thrower.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant is frustrated to have seemingly hit a dead end, but urges you stay hopeful, and look through the pieces of wreckage for anything that might prove your father’s innocence. There has to be something...

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant recommends searching the wreckage for clues.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant urges you to extract whatever you can from the wreckage.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Find:
Useful flotsam [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant didn't find anything useful in this barrel.

children.name: Text
children.value: After Mr. Ticker expert learned your honest and upright intentions, he spills important information for you: Your father was murdered. Mr. Ticker says the murderer fleed prison not long before you came to rescue him. The murderer is said to deal with smugglers, trading near Madame Kahina's harbour— that is your lead.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant advises you to follow the smuggler ship.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant urges you to extract whatever you can from the wreckage.

children.name: Text
children.value: Follow smuggler ship undetected to your Father's murderer

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant asks if you are ready to follow the smuggler's ship.

children.name: Text
children.value: Keeping the right distance is the key to success. Stay close, but not too close!

children.name: Text
children.value: Items and cargo can affect ship speed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Extending your customer network is the best way to increase your reputation and your opportunities.

children.name: Text
children.value: Madame Kahina promises to trade with you if you provide her with ship repair materials.

children.name: Text
children.value: Madame Kahina is reminding you about the delivery of steel beams.

children.name: Text
children.value: Madame Kahina is happy about your delivery and predicts long, fruitful partnership with you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Deliver the following goods to Madame Kahina:

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asks you to bring the diary to Madame Kahina to decipher the symbols.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to go and see Kahina.

children.name: Text
children.value: Madame Kahina warns you the symbol belongs to a dangerous sect known as the Pyrphorians.

children.name: Text
children.value: Madame Kahina asks you what you want to show her.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake read in the newspaper of your first shipyard, and asked for a bulk order of ships for the Queen. The Queen apparently needs a fleet with which to sail to the New World, where she intends to take back the island Prosperity your father apparently sold.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake read your newspaper and issues a bulk order of ships for the Queen.

children.name: Text
children.value: He says supporting the Queen will greatly benefit your relationship.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake thanks you very much for delivering the ships.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake confirms the exchange.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sell a ship by bringing it to Archibald's harbor. Then select the ship and click the "Sell" button in the bottom right.

children.name: Text
children.value: It turns out Hannah’s gut feeling was right: Madame Kahina was able to identify the symbol and link it to a dangerous New World organisation known as The Pyrphorians. Since the diary also states that your father did not unlawfully sell the island Prosperity, Hannah wants you to bring the diary to Sir Archibald Blake immediately. This might reverse the Queen's accusation of treason towards your father.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asks that you take the diary to Sir Archibald at once.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah urges you to take the diary to Sir Archibald.

children.name: Text
children.value: Deliver Father's Diary to Sir Archibald Blake

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake asks what you are bringing him.

children.name: Text
children.value: Archibald Blake promised to recommend a specialist to you in return for the schooner ship you traded with him. He is waiting for you at your harbour.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake has placed a crate containing a gift at his harbor pier

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald is glad of the exchange, but would have preferred a gunboat for the Queen's fleet.

children.name: Text
children.value: Pick up crate at Sir Archibald Blake's harbour

children.name: Text
children.value: You decided to help the escapist escape, while not knowing exactly what scares him.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant wants you to escort the ship of the escapist.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant prefers to remain vigilant until the escapist's ship reaches its objective.

children.name: Text
children.value: The escapist thanks you for saving him from his assailants and gifts you your father's diary.

children.name: Text
children.value: Only a demolitions expert will enable you to complete the mountain excavation, and establish a connection to the iron mine.

children.name: Text
children.value: Eli Bleakworth doesn't think you will find anybody of worth here, but won't try to stop you.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Expert’s wife reminds you to look for her husband in the prison.

children.name: Text
children.value: Search the Demolitions Expert in the stone pit at Prison Governor's island

children.name: Text
children.value: Pay 5000 coins bailout at Prison Governor's lighthouse

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is excited to receive such a large order of ships.

children.name: Text
children.value: The demolition expert wonders if you might be able to change things for the better.

children.name: Text
children.value: The demolition expert Thomas wonders whether you can bring back Samuel's spirit.

children.name: Text
children.value: Thomas admits you have your father's eyes.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mr. Ticker is impressed by your efforts and achievements, which honour your father.

children.name: Text
children.value: Thomas starts to see the good in you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah tells you about your next goal: gain access to iron mines.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah wants you to find a specialist to help digging a tunnel to the iron mine.

children.name: Text
children.value: Madame Kahina warns you the symbol belongs to a dangerous sect known as the Pyrphorians.

children.name: Text
children.value: Madame Kahina didn't know your father was in contact with the Pyrphorians.

children.name: Text
children.value: Madame Kahina urges you not to go to the New World, where the Pyrphorian sect run wild.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald reveals that the Pyrphorians are also a danger to the Queen.

children.name: Text
children.value: He admits it is not clear how your father is involved in this matter.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald explains your father sold the infamous island Prosperity to a rebel named Isabel Sarmento.

children.name: Text
children.value: He states that Isabel is in hiding and that you need to find her.

children.name: Text
children.value: The demolition expert Thomas N. Ticker despises to be traded around.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mr. Ticker disapproves of your naive ambitions.

children.name: Text
children.value: The hooded man threatens to kill you just as he killed your father.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant is surprised the killer would admit his crime so easily.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mr. Ticker opens up to you, admitting he kept your father's murder secret.

children.name: Text
children.value: He explains that your father's killer is hiding somewhere.

children.name: Text
children.value: Mr. Ticker hints at a smuggler, bringing supplies to the murderer.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah’s suspicions regarding the circumstances of your father’s death are confirmed.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant is frustrated the killer has died without giving you answers.

children.name: Text
children.value: The killer’s last words appear to be a warning.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah realises your father's trouble stems from the island sale.

children.name: Text
children.value: Wormways Prison— A first terrible night!

children.name: Text
children.value: My island, Prosperity, is sold. That is all I can puzzle of my arrest, and present circumstance, shackled between these cold grey walls. Tomorrow I resolve to make my case again to Mr. Bleakworth, who today so cruelly refused me a proper explanation. Now I must try to sleep, and can think of nothing but my poor Hannah, and the other, so far distant.

children.name: Text
children.value: Wormways Prison – Light through the bars.

children.name: Text
children.value:
With daybreak comes clarity. Prosperity was sold to the infamous rebel “Sarmento” – and I must be the last to have heard of it! The Queen, the nation, is up in arms, that the jewel of the new world is lost!

The guards, from whom I heard all, thought me playing some trick! Yet it is I who am tricked; duped of my island by persons unknown! Although it can only be the same persons that came to me one ominous day, masked and embroidered with eldrich symbols. They pressed me towards a sale. But I shut the door hard I tell you, and bid them good-day!

children.name: Text
children.value: Wormways - A third night, and alas not the last.

children.name: Text
children.value: I have today begun the process of gathering evidence in my defence. Hannah was here, though they did not let her stay long. She gives me hope that a full and unmitigated pardon is possible. Years of loyalty count in my favour, but the very idea that I may have betrayed my Queen weighs heavily upon me. Even if the dark clouds of scandal pass, they may forever have damaged our family’s prospects.

children.name: Text
children.value: Thomas N. Ticker sees no purpose in trying to impress your father now he is dead.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento claims your father Samuel sold Prosperity to her, and that she has the contract of sale to prove it. But since this document is her sole bargaining chip, she will relinquish it to you only if you come to the aid of her people. Admittedly, the situation for the rebels does seem rather desperate...

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento asks you to secure her people before handing over Prosperity's contract.

children.name: Text
children.value: Fulfill Isabel Sarmento's demands to receive Prosperity Sale contract

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento needs your help to shelter her people and hide them away from the Pyrphorian threat. With this purpose, she has transferred La Isla to you. She asks that you start by providing asylum for her refugees. Maybe then she will be able to trust you with the Properity papers.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel agrees to help you once you help them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel asks that you prove yourself trustworthy.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Shelter:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] on La Isla

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorians have Prosperity terrorized and overworked to the brim of exhaustion. Isabel Sarmento solicits that you go there to find her debilitated refugees and smuggle them away to La Isla to recover.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel asks that you tend to Prosperity's sickly refugees on La Isla.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah wonders how Prosperity looks like.

children.name: Text
children.value: A jornalero rejoices on leaving Prosperity and the Pyrphorians' yoke.

children.name: Text
children.value: A jornalero hopes it is finally safe for them on la Isla.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Pick up:
1 Group of Prosperity Refugees from Prosperity Island

children.name: Text
children.value:
Deliver:
[Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] from Prosperity Island to La Isla

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento asks if the refugees can board your ship.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento asks if the sick refugees are ready to disembark on La Isla.

children.name: Text
children.value: Still, more people suffer every day under the Pyrphorians' clenched fists. Your haven on La Isla must expand if you are to accommodate them all.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel pleads for you to expand to shelter more people on La Isla.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel is grateful to you for aiding her people.

children.name: Text
children.value: A sudden outbreak of fires plagues La Isla. It all seems a little too attuned to be unrelated. Still, before you can think of the cause, a fire station is required to put them all out.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah finds the multiples fires a strange coincidence, and asks you to build a fire station.

children.name: Text
children.value: Put out all fires on La Isla

children.name: Text
children.value: Check the whole island, not just the city center, for fires and build firestations near burning buildings.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your officers have uncovered the arsonists and are ready to apprehend them at your command. Find them around the market and rid La Isla of their troubling torchings.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel prompts you to capture the Pyrphorians spies with the help of the police.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Find:
[Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] Pyrphorians to stop the arson

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel is happy you got rid of the arsonists.

children.name: Text
children.value: Zoom in to your city center and search people with torches.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorian arsonist taunts you as you arrest him.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sarmento confirms that the conflagrations on La Isla are likely to be the Pyrphorians' doing. Police officers will keep their eyes peeled for any of their masked arsonists if you build a station.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel encourages you to build a police station to arrest the Pyrphorian arsonists.

children.name: Text
children.value: Pyrphorians are a very real threat to La Isla now that they know you are sheltering Isabel's people there. After the wave of conflagrations and attacks on refugee transports, Sarmento is rightly wary that they may strike soon again. She asks that you bring two frigates to their shores to keep the citizens safe.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel fears her people might be in danger.

children.name: Text
children.value: She asks you to build up your military defenses to protect them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Have [Conditions QuestCondition Amount] Frigates in the The New World

children.name: Text
children.value: Sarmento congratulates you and is looking forward to fighting alongside you.

children.name: Text
children.value: There is no Iron for Weapons in the New World. Construct Frigates in the Old World, to bring and trade Weapons with Isabel in the New World.

children.name: Text
children.value: You can transfer ships from the Old World to the New World by clicking the worldmap button in the top right of a ship's menu.

children.name: Text
children.value: The sick citizens of Prosperity will not resist much longer. Too weak to continue working at the pace the Pyrphorians demand, they are doomed unless you bring them to La Isla to rest and recover in peace.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel worries the ill on Prosperity will perish unless you bring them to La Isla.

children.name: Text
children.value: A jornalero begs you to rescue them from slavery.

children.name: Text
children.value: A jornalero is very grateful to you.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Pick up:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] from Prosperity Island

children.name: Text
children.value: A masked Pyrphorian commands you to return the people you took.

children.name: Text
children.value: Pyrphorian assaults have the people of the New World completely terrorized. Isabel will not turn her back on anyone that requests asylum on La Isla, which is why she requests that you expand your settlement on La Isla and prepare for any eventualities with a hospital.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel needs you to expand to shelter all the people running from the Pyrphorians.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel wants to build a hospital to prepare for a potential outbreak.

children.name: Text
children.value: An obrera thanks you for creating a safe haven for them.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorian threat hovers over the whole region and Isabel's headquarters are not safe anymore. She petitions for your protection in evacuating her people to the safety of La Isla.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sarmento asks for your help in evacuating her headquarters.

children.name: Text
children.value: An obrera thanks you for saving them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Escort at least 1 of Isabel's Schooners to La Isla

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorians might have learned of Isabel's plans. Bring all of your ships to defend the escort trade ships.

children.name: Text
children.value: You can command your ships to escort Isabel's ship automatically by selecting your ship and right-clicking on Isabel's ships.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorian don't seem to let go of you, they keep attacking. Because of this, Isabel strongly suggests to bring more military ships to this region to be able to defend yourself.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel instructs you to bring even more ships to this region since Pyrphorian attacks intensify.

children.name: Text
children.value: Trade [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData(100440) Text] with Isabel Sarmento.

children.name: Text
children.value: While you build more ships and bring them to Isabel's region, she also wants you to enlargen the town even further

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel tells you to keep on expanding La Isla for the obreros.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel's comrades were taken hostages to coerce her into working for the Pyrphorians, but now she is confident that you will be able to rescue them from their humid cells on the western archipelago. However, evading the Pyrphorian guards will not be easy.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel has received intelligence as to the whereabouts of her abducted comrades, and asks that you free them.

children.name: Text
children.value: A hostage is deeply grateful for your actions.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorian Hostages are ready to get on board of your ship.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel trusts you after bringing her comrades back.

children.name: Text
children.value: Rescue Pyrphorian Hostages from [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ExecutionObject]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Deliver [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition CurrentDeliveryObject]) Text] to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition ExecutionObject]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Deliver [Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] to La Isla

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel expresses her gratitiude for bringing the missing people back home.

children.name: Text
children.value: There are Pyrphorian patrol ships inside the island atoll. Don't get into their sight radius, or else they will attack you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel is under attack! They have discovered that she's been working with you to save the people on Prosperity and send a fleet to burn down her island. You must rush to aid her troops!

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel needs your help to fend off the Pyrphorians.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Destroy:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] that attack Isabel

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel pleads for your help one last time.

children.name: Text
children.value: Only the Prosperity's sale contract will prove not only that it was not your father but an impostor who sold the island to Sarmento, but that she was coerced to make that deal by the Pyrphorians. You must chase the thieves and retrieve it to stop the Queen from arresting Isabel and her people.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel realises the Pyrphorians have stolen Prosperity's contract.

children.name: Text
children.value: To start the expedition, go to the World Map and click the Expedition named "The Contract".

children.name: Text
children.value: Once the Expedition is finished, wait for the ship to return and select the Expedition Ship to collect the reward.

children.name: Text
children.value: The one who signed the deal for the island accepted a payment in goods. If you follow these tracks, you may find the right person.

children.name: Text

children.value: The magistrate reminds you to pick up a camera.

children.name: Text

children.name: Text
children.value: The one who signed the deal for the island accepted a payment in goods. If you follow these tracks, you may find the right person.

children.value: Hannah advises you to follow the La Corona trade ship.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah makes you aware to keep a proper distance when the next ship starts.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah makes you aware to stay closer when the next ship starts.

children.name: Text
children.value: The secret agent asks you if you're ready to start tailing.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah urges you to make a photo of the secret deal.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is shocked to see that Edvard is behind the deal.
