children.value: Follow the La Corona ship to its destination

children.name: Text
children.value: Keep your distance from the La Corona ship

children.name: Text
children.value: Take a photograph of the trade

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah urges you to come around analyzing the photo.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel tells bitterly how your father's actions worsened her cause.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel mentions that she somehow still trusted in your father and did not believe these actions.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel tells you that the best way to start your investigation is by finding the sale contract.

children.name: Text
children.value: The magistrate tells you that the contract is still in his former house.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel transfers you the magistrate's home island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel gives you the freedom to manage this island to make the magistrate come back.

children.name: Text
children.value: The magistrate oversteps the mark by asking for a zoo.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen transfers the island rights to you.

children.name: Text
children.value: The magistrate officially revokes the island's sale.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah can't wait to confront your uncle once back home.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel thanks you for saving her and her people.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah wonders why Isabel has yet to hand you the Prosperity contract.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake announces that the Queen's fleet is ready to reclaim Prosperity.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah believes the Prosperity papers will prove that Isabel is not the Queen's enemy.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is proud of you for retrieving the contract in time.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel fears the Pyrphorian ships approaching her island.

children.name: Text
children.value: A Pyrphorian threatens Isabel for contravening their orders.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorian orders an attack on Isabel's island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah shares a letter she has received from a small boy.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorians threaten you to leave the region at once.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel warns that the Pyrphorians have taken notice of you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Progeny of Samuel, you know not with whom you meddle.

children.name: Text
children.value: Leave, if you value your life, else all shall burn.

children.name: Text
children.value: Pyrphorians will not let you meddle with their affairs.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento explains the danger on Prosperity and settling on other islands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel believes you have better odds at hiding them from the Pyrphorians.

children.name: Text
children.value: Please bring us back to a safe place ...

children.name: Text
children.value: The final evidence that uncle Edvard is the guilty one.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hostages of the Pyrphorians, Isabel Sarmento's people

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard was the one behind the unrightful selling of the oil island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah congratulates you on getting the final proof and wants you to deliver it to the council.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah urges you to bring the photo proof to the council.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen takes over the photo.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento was your father's contact in the New World, selling him an important oil island. She was deceived because your father allegedly sold it back to her opposing La Corona.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah wants you to talk to Isabel Sarmento.

children.name: Text
children.value: You tracked down the secret trade between La Corona and an unknown person. Take a photograph to prove who benefits from the Prosperity deal.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah urges you to make a photo of the secret deal.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorians persist with their schemes. More fires are raging through the settlement, spreading fear and danger. You have to arrest the arsonists and stop this madness!

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is frightened that more Pyrphorian arsonists have snuck onto your island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is relieved you apprehended the arsonists.

children.name: Text
children.value: Having returned from the New World with conclusive evidence that it was your uncle's treason that sealed your father's fate, Hannah is eager to finally confront Edvard in Bright Sands and learn the truth once and for all.

children.name: Text
children.value: She cannot wait to arrive at Bright Sands and confront him.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Deliver:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] from your Trading Post to Edvard

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard asks what is your business here.

children.name: Text
children.value: Bring a ship to your main island trading post, and transfer the Prosperity Contract to it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Some managed to escape the great fire of Bright Sands through the city's sewers, you must come to their rescue! But beware, Pyrphorian patrols have the place heavily guarded. If you are found, all of their lives will be jeopardised...

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah begs you to evacuate Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Slip past Pyrphorian patrols to Sewer Exit of Bright Sands

children.name: Text
children.value:
Deliver:
[Conditions QuestCondition Amount(ObjectiveIndex)] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition DeliveryObject(ObjectiveIndex)]) Text] to your island

children.name: Text
children.value: Theodora Ticker is thrilled you have come to their rescue.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah appalled that you could not help the people of Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asks if the Bright Sands refugees are ready to disembark.

children.name: Text
children.value: Slip past Pyrphorian patrols and deliver [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition CurrentDeliveryObject]) Text] to your island

children.name: Text
children.value: Don't get into the patrols' sight radius, or they will attack.

children.name: Text
children.value: The smaller and faster the ship you use for this, the higher the success chance. Try it with a Gunboat.

children.name: Text
children.value: It is over. The Pyrphorian army has been forsaken, but they have done great damage. Before you can move on, the dead must be mourned. Meet Hannah at the Church with a cemetary in Bright Sands for your Uncle's funeral.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah would like you to be there for your Uncle's funeral.

children.name: Text
children.value: Select the Church with a cemetery in Bright Sands

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorians have infiltrated your island and are causing chaos all over by setting your buildings on fire! Hurry up and catch the arsonists before it's too late!

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asks you to arrest the Pyrphorian arsonists on your island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah worries you let the arsonists escape.

children.name: Text
children.value: Search for hooded figures with torches in their hand. Zoom in to see them better.

children.name: Text
children.value: Now that you have finally delivered Bright Sands from the Pyrphorian terror, Hannah hopes you can resurrect the city closest to her heart. Your father's dream, your childhood home; it will take a hard work, but you have the power to dream up your own vision of Bright Sands now!

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah has something ambitious in mind.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asks you to rebuild Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah trusts everything to you from now on.

children.name: Text
children.value: Demolish the ruins on Bright Sands, or renovate individual buildings you want to keep.

children.name: Text
children.value: With the demolish tool selected, hold Shift and drag to demolish all buildings.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Attract to Bright Sands:
[Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Her Majesty has placed Edvard under custody on his residence in Bright Sands, where he will await his trial for treason. The Queen has appointed you to host this trial at your island, for which you are required to erect a Court of Justice.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake announces you are to build a Court of Justice to hold Edvard's trial.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen admires your Court of Justice.

children.name: Text
children.value: Finish the first phase of the Court of Justice

children.name: Text
children.value: Finish the second phase of the Court of Justice

children.name: Text
children.value: Finish the last phase of the Court of Justice

children.name: Text
children.value: A Court of Justice, issued from the Queen to be built. The trial against Edvard Goode is supposed to be held here.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen is getting impatient to see your Court of Justice.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake reminds you to finish preparations before the Queen's arrival.

children.name: Text
children.value: Place a Warehouse close to the Court of Justice, and produce the required goods for it.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorians have taken over Bright Sands! They pulled the strings behind Uncle Edvard's betrayal, causing his and your father's demise. Now, they threaten to turn the Empire to ashes along with everything you hold dear. However deadful their army, you have no choice: they must be stopped!

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald says protecting the Queen is of the utmost importance.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Destroy:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] at Bright Sands harbour

children.name: Text
children.value: Take your time to build a large fleet. Equipping powerful items on your ships and using them will be very helpful.

children.name: Text
children.value: Target one enemy ship at a time with your whole fleet to minimize their numbers as quickly as possible.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald wants to support your fight against the Pyrphorians by sending you supplies from the Queen. Though his shipments will need to be escorted in case they stumble upon Pyrphorians patrols.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald request an escort to send you supplies.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald is relieved you received his supplies.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald fears you cannot afford to lose his next batch of supplies.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Protect:
Royal Supply ship until it reaches The Queen's Flagship

children.name: Text
children.value: Don't underestimate the fervour of the Pyrphorian attackers during your escort. Bring strong military ships to flank the royal supply ship.

children.name: Text
children.value: You will get important supplies when fulfilling this quest. These will help you with the main quest.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald Blake asks if you are ready to receive the Royal supplies and munitions.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald announces the next supply ship and wants you to protect it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant has the feeling a darker threat looms over the horizon. He asks you to prepare for anything that may happen by building up your harbour defences.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant feels you must prepare for an eventual attack.

children.name: Text
children.value: Edvard repents and warns you about a greater enemy.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is determined not to forgive Uncle Edvard.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen acknowledges your efforts to protect the Empire.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen seems rather ambivalent about the trial.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant is surprised at the Queen's... assertiveness.

children.name: Text
children.value: After taking over Bright Sands, the Pyrphorians are coming for you! Prepare to fend off their incoming attack!

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant alerts you about an incoming Pyrphorian attack.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah asks you to end the Pyrphorians.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Destroy:
[AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] approaching your harbour

children.name: Text
children.value: Now is the time to make a dent in the Pyrphorian army! Aarhant prompted you to attack the Pyrphorian patrols that roam the oceans and decimate their numbers. And the cargo they carry might also prove useful against them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant advises to debilitate Pyrphorian forces by raiding their patrols.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel encourages you to break Pyrphorian supply lines.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant advises not to lower your guard against the Pyrphorians.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant advises to be wary of the Pyrphorian menace.

children.name: Text
children.value: You will get strong military items when fulfilling this quest. These will help you with the main quest.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorian fleet is huge, and a great and final confrontation seems inevitable. Aarhant has long-since anticipated such a battle, and makes his recommendations on how to counter the Pyrphorian threat with a mighty fleet of your own.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant suggests which ships you should build for the great battle ahead.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant believes these ships capable of defeating the Pyrphorians.

children.name: Text
children.value: Two shipyards working at the same time will raise your ship output. The same goes for Weapon Factories.

children.name: Text
children.value: You can also buy weapons at Isabel's island in The Old World.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your island defences are suficient to guarantee the Queen's safety and the Court of Justice is ready to hold the trial. Her Majesty and Sir Archibald Blake await your welcome at your harbour before taking their place in the tribunal.

children.name: Text
children.value: Welcome the Queen in your Harbour

children.name: Text
children.value: Preparations for the trial are complete, only retrieving the defendant from his house arrest remains. The Queen has comanded you to sail to Bright Sands to fetch Uncle Edvard.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen is ready to see Edvard for the Trial.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Pick up:
Court Summons from The Queen's Flagship

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen wants to hand over the Court Summons for you to issue to Edvard.

children.name: Text
children.value: Bring a ship within range of the Queen's flagship that has at least one cargo slot free.

children.name: Text
children.value: Once your ship draws close to the Queen, accept the request she has for you.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant is hardly surprised to hear Edvard was behind this all along.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is furious about Edvard's treason.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen expects your Court of Justice to serve the Empire well.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald believes Isabel Sarmento will be the perfect witness for the trial.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento agrees to testify on Edvard's trial.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sir Archibald announces the Queen's arrival.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen waves off Archibald's overly formal introduction.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen is keen to start the trial.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento presents herself for the trial.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento hopes her testimony will clear their name.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant is horrified by the Pyrphorians taking over Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorian Grandmaster threatens your family.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento vows to fight with you against the Pyrphorians.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Queen is determined to end this fighting.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorian Grandmaster threatens and ridicules you.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorian Grandmaster refuses to accept defeat.

children.name: Text
children.value: The Pyrphorian Grandmaster vows to return and get revenge.

children.name: Text
children.value: Theodora Ticker is finally reunited with her husband.

children.name: Text
children.value: Thomas Ticker is relieved his wife is safe.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant celebrates your victory against the Pyrphorians.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah praises you for your victory against the Pyrphorians.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is excited to be welcoming the Queen to Bright Sands.

children.name: Text
children.value: The signature was forged by your Uncle. Your father is innocent.

children.name: Text
children.value: A document summoning Edvard Goode's to trial.

children.name: Text
children.value: Since you managed to settle the potentially catastrophic dispute over Prosperity, the Queen has decided to entrust the island to you. Isabel Sarmento hands over the keys to the golden gates of Prosperity, an island that evokes only bad memories for her and her people.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel dismantled all of her rebel structures on Prosperity. The island is all yours now.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento is happy to see you once again.

children.name: Text
children.value: Isabel Sarmento is travelling to the Old World to be principal witness at the trial against Edvard.

children.name: Text
children.value:
Select in the New World:
Prosperity Trading Post

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah suggests that you settle an island soon.

children.name: Text
children.value: You just started your company, but you own no island yet. This is your priority task for now.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is glad that you built your first Trading Post.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build a trading post on an island that offers basic fertilities: potatoes, wheat, iron and clay.

children.name: Text
children.value: Islands resources are different from an island to another. Potatoes, clay, wheat and iron are great for a starting island.

children.name: Text
children.value: You need to approach the beach of the desired island to build your harbor and settle it officially.

children.name: Text
children.value: To build your harbor, select the ghost of the harbor at the desired location, and select the build option.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah advises you to start building your company town.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your company first requires employees. Start building some houses, a market and some infrastructure for them to live on your island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is glad to see your first employees arriving on your island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build your company town: houses, a market and some streets are the first buildings to construct.

children.name: Text
children.value: Residences, market and streets are found in the construction menu.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your houses need to be build close to the market to have access to it.

children.name: Text
children.value: All buildings need to be linked to the trading post, else no one will access them.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah worries about your planks stock.

children.name: Text
children.value: New companies need a lot of infrastructure and buildings for their company town. Construction materials are the corner stone of our company development.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build a productive planks production chain.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah remarks your new planks industry.

children.name: Text
children.value: All goods are produced with production buildings. You can find them in your construction menu.

children.name: Text
children.value: You will need a woodcutter who will produce wood for the carpenter to make the planks. Both are required to establish a working production chains.

children.name: Text
children.value: A woodcutter needs access to a carpenter or to a storage. But the carpenter will require the access to a storage. Your trading post is the first storage you have.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah reminds you to connect your residences to a marketplace.

children.name: Text
children.value: No one will live in a house if it doesn't have access to a market.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build a productive planks production chain.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is satisfied that you finally placed a market for your farmers.

children.name: Text
children.value: Make sure your farmers have access to a marketplace.

children.name: Text
children.value: Streets can be found in the construction menu.

children.name: Text
children.value: Houses will always require an access to a market. Market can be found in the construction menu.

children.name: Text
children.value: You can place streets by drag and drop.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is worried one production building can't deliver its goods.

children.name: Text
children.value: All your production buildings deliver their finished goods to another production buildings, else to a warehouse. If they can't do so, their internal storage gets full and the production stops.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is glad to see your production running efficiently.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build a warehouse close to your production buildings or relocate them near an existing storage.

children.name: Text
children.value: Warehouses are simple storages where all your goods can be delivered. They can be found in the construction menu. But as they are expensive, it's sometimes better to relocate your production buildings around existing warehouses.

children.name: Text
children.value: A production building can produce goods used by another production building. In this case it will deliver the goods directly to the building using it. It's more efficient to place the warehouse close to the production buidlings producing final goods (planks, fish, schnapps...).

children.name: Text
children.value: Warehouses share the same storage: all goods delivered to a warehouse are then accessible from all warehouses of the island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah notices that one of your buildings can't access your Trading Post.

children.name: Text
children.value: Markets and warehouses require a street connection to the trading post, else they can't access to your island storage.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is glad to see your infrastructure up and running.

children.name: Text
children.value: Make sure all markets and warehouses are connected to the trading post.

children.name: Text
children.value: Warehouses are simple storages where all your goods can be delivered. They can be found in the construction menu. But as they are expensive, it's sometimes better to relocate your production buildings around existing warehouses.

children.name: Text
children.value: A production building can produce goods used by another production building. In this case it will deliver the goods directly to the building using it. It's more efficient to place the warehouse close to the production buidlings producing final goods (planks, fish, schnapps...).

children.name: Text
children.value: Warehouses share the same storage: all goods delivered to a warehouse are then accessible from all warehouses of the island.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah suggests that you keep an eye on your people's demands.

children.name: Text
children.value: The more employees you have, the more demanding they become. If you provide the goods and services they ask for, the houses will welcome more and more employees. But if you don't, they may leave.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build a productive planks production chain.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is sure that more farmers will soon join your settlement.

children.name: Text
children.value: Fishery can only be built at the coast. The ideal location may be close to the trading post, but it still requires a street connection.

children.name: Text
children.value: Once delivered to a warehouse, goods that are consumed by your people like fish are immediately accessible from the market. Make sure that you have enough stock for your population.

children.name: Text
children.value: The range of your market and the stock your have determines how good the supply will be for a house. Make sure that those two factors are as efficient as possible, else your people may leave.

children.name: Text
children.value: The more employees you have, the more demanding they become. If you provide the goods and services they ask for, the houses will welcome more and more employees. But if you don't, they will leave.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah despises the new schnapps demand of your employees.

children.name: Text
children.value: You second advisor Aarhant suggests that you produce schnapps.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is glad that you keep your resources for more serious projects.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is worried about what you're doing with your company.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant is happy you changed your mind.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant suggests that you start producing schnapps.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah and Aarhant will never agree on some topics, but you choosed to follow Aarhant's voice. Your people sometimes desire some recreation goods, that provide happiness and some additional taxes, but the production will cost workforce and resources. Schnapps is the first production chain of such a comfort need.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build a productive planks production chain.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aarhant already saw many farmers smiling without any reason.

children.name: Text
children.value: Schnapps is made out of potatoes. You first need to establish a potato farm, then a distillery.

children.name: Text
children.value: Farms need fields. Once the farm placed, you need to select the building and pick the field option to place the fields along the main building.

children.name: Text
children.value: Comfort needs require some workforce to make it run, but the reward in taxes and happiness is high. Yet, you'll find new ways to provide happiness to your people later on.

children.name: Text
children.value: Farms are useless without fields and enclosures. If you want to grow plants or raise herds, you need to build the fields.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build a productive planks production chain.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah appreciates the farmland view you developped.

children.name: Text
children.value: Make sure your farmers have some fields to work in.

children.name: Text
children.value: Each farm requires its own fields to produce goods. You can find the construction option by selecting the farm.

children.name: Text
children.value: Each farm has its own optimal area size of agricultural fieds. But you don't have to reach this optimal size to have the building working.

children.name: Text
children.value: Farmfields are very small and can be placed anywhere as long as they stand alongside the farm. Yet pastures don't have to be placed alongside the farm, they just need to be placed in its range.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is certainly paranoid about fire, but her worries are not always unfounded. So many wooden huts can easily burn, hence it's safer to have a fire station around.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build a productive planks production chain.

children.name: Text
children.value: Prepare your settlement against city incidents: a fire station will prevent fires.

children.name: Text
children.value: City institutions, like fire stations, take a bit of time to build. Don't wait for a fire to start to build one, it could escalate quickly.

children.name: Text
children.value: Fire stations reduce the risk of fire in their reach. Also, fire chances increase for heavy factories and when houses are piled on each other.

children.name: Text
children.value: Fire stations also automatically extinguish fires. In case the fire rages, you can select your city institution and deploy extra units to face an inferno.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah suggests to improve your housing quality.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your farmers are completely supplied with all they need, and you have enough of them to start upgrading your houses. Better housing quality will attract a new working class in your city.

children.name: Text
children.value: Build a productive planks production chain.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is glad to welcome new employees.

children.name: Text
children.value: Increase the housing quality of your settlement.

children.name: Text
children.value: Upgrading a house can be done by selecting the corresponding button in the house menu, or by using the upgrade mode.

children.name: Text
children.value: Upgrading has a cost: mostly in resources.

children.name: Text
children.value: Only houses that have reached the maximum amount of inhabitants can be upgraded, if you can afford it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah advises you to keep an eye on your workforces.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah suggests that you settle an island soon.

children.name: Text
children.value: You just started your company, but you own no island yet. Building a harbour and settling on an island is your priority task for now.

children.name: Text
children.value: Settle your desired island: Build your first [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah suggests that you expand the settlement and meet the demands of your employees.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your settlement is in place. Now you need to expand the city and meet the growing demands in food and clothing of your employees. If enough of them are satisfied and their housing is improved, you can expect new talents working for you, soon.

children.name: Text
children.value: Basic Food: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Growing workforce: Provide [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Clothing: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% supply of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is looking forward to the industrialization of your settlement.

children.name: Text
children.value: The new social class, the workers, is really fitting to factory work. Keep expanding your settlement and start the production of steel beams, as those are necessary materials to build powerful factories.

children.name: Text
children.value: Factory work: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Men of Steel: Have [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] tons of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] in stock

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is worrying about the latent workers movement.

children.name: Text
children.value: Hard factory work and child labor lead the workers to voice claims and complaints. If you don't want to enter an instability state, you should take care of your security and provide education.

children.name: Text
children.value: Preventing Riots: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: End of Child Work: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% access to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Healthy Housing: Renovate your workers residences

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah suggests to start exploring the world for exotic productions.

children.name: Text
children.value: With your first artisans in town, your city is now ready to build stronger ships to explore distant lands. If you can reach there, you'll be able to produce exotic, valuable goods to bring back to the Old World. An opportunity no company shall neglect.

children.name: Text
children.value: Send an [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] to the New World

children.name: Text
children.value: Day Dreamers: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah recommends to import goods from the New World for your artisans.

children.name: Text
children.value: The New World benefits from a tropical climate that enables the growth of many different plants. That's your chance to import exotic and expensive goods to Europe, which, with a higher education, will participate in the happiness and social rise of your artisans.

children.name: Text
children.value: Colony: Build a [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text] in the New World

children.name: Text
children.value: High Society: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: New Cotton Fashion: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% supply of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Progression of Science: Build an [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Comfortable Residences: Renovate your artisans residences

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah suggests to electrify your settlement.

children.name: Text
children.value: Engineers can establish electricity networks that can empower your production buildings. If you dig oil from the oil fields and transport it by rail to your generators, not only will your engineers enjoy the night lights, but your production buildings will get a great boost of productivity.

children.name: Text
children.value: New Black Gold: Build an [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Enlightenment: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% access to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Engineers Demanded: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is eager to start investing into lucrative production.

children.name: Text
children.value: With electricity running through your settlement, your company is ready to become one of the major companies in the world. You can start the production of the luxurious pocket watches, and make sure to have a bank for your employees.

children.name: Text
children.value: Aristocracy: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Luxury Watch: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% supply of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Savings Accounts: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% access to [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Somptuous Estates: Renovate your engineers residences

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah suggests to start building the World Fair.

children.name: Text
children.value: Some of your engineers enriched themselves until reaching the highest tier of the society. They will never agree to work, but they would surely invest in worldwide events like the World Fair. It is time to start building a monument, and prepare for the festivities.

children.name: Text
children.value: Stocks for the Inauguration: Save [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] tons of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Access for the Aristocracy: Reach [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount]% supply of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Investors Required: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah is eager to see your city as highest visited city in the world.

children.name: Text
children.value: The World Fair is ready. This immense building is the perfect place to organize somptuous exhibitions where the greatest minds in the world would bring and showcase their latest inventions, discoveries and constructions. If you can successfully organize an event, you may have access to the most attractive items for your cultural buildings, and become the most attractive city in the world.

children.name: Text
children.value: Destination of the Richest: Host [Conditions QuestCondition CurrentAmount]/[Conditions QuestCondition Amount] [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Legendary Artifacts: Organize some exhibitions and reach the status of [AssetData([Conditions QuestCondition Context]) Text]

children.name: Text
children.value: Hannah congratulates you on reaching the highest city status.

children.name: Text
children.value: "Having doubts, old pal? I know settling down was never for you, but let's see where this leads."

children.name: Text
children.value: "Wherever we go, marketplaces are the heart of the town. Where else would we get what we need?"

children.name: Text
children.value: "Are you looking to imprison your people in their homes? They need roads to travel!" #3

children.name: Text
children.value: "Your people and their carriages can't go anywhere without streets. Unless they suddenly sprout wings!"

children.name: Text
children.value: "Alas, trains in my home do not benefit the common people. But now, you have the chance to make a railroad that benefits everyone."

children.name: Text
children.value: "There would be little without wood. No ships and no houses. You better look after this now."

children.name: Text
children.value: "These bags of meat intrigue me, but better for all if you give them to your people." #7

children.name: Text
children.value: "I frown upon this needlessly strong drink, but it is part of your people's custom and you should appease them." #8

children.name: Text
children.value: "I know we reeked on the high seas, but there's no reason your people should be deprived of soap." #9

children.name: Text
children.value: "Have you been out at sea so long that you've forgotten about life on land? You need fields to grow anything."

children.name: Text
children.value: "Your animals might be destined for slaughter, but this does not absolve you of giving them enough space."

children.name: Text
children.value: "With no rivers around, your people rely on wash houses, I hear. So where are they?"

children.name: Text
children.value: "My understanding is that pubs aren't just for drinking, but community. Don't deny your people that."

children.name: Text
children.value: "Just a spark can be enough to start a blaze! Don't be lenient when it comes to your people's safety."

children.name: Text
children.value: "Buildings made of bricks can withstand the strongest winds and fiercest fires. You'd be wise to invest in them." #15

children.name: Text
children.value: "For every situation there is an appropriate garment. Do you expect your people to work in their nightgowns?" #16

children.name: Text
children.value: "The revival of your father's business is finally within reach. Everything is prepared for a Shipyard, so why the hesitation?" #17

children.name: Text
children.value: "Be mindful of others' needs. Unhappy followers will turn their back on you."

children.name: Text
children.value: "How can you reach for the stars when your foundation is crumbling? You need more farmers."

children.name: Text
children.value: "Just a spark can is enough to start a blaze! No time to waste, let's get help to these people, quickly!"

children.name: Text
children.value: "As your guardian I must ask you to take protective measures, for your own sake."

children.name: Text
children.value: "Disease was dangerous enough on our travels, but these people cannot just leave! Let's get them help!"

children.name: Text
children.value: "You've got loyal followers, but they won't live off goodwill alone. You should see to their well-being."

children.name: Text
children.value: Islands vary in their riches. Examine the fertilities and deposits in this overview to help you choose where to settle.

children.name: Text
children.value: Islands vary in their riches. Examine their fertilities and deposits before you decide where to settle.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sail to the coast of the island you want to settle and build a Trading Post to claim it officially.

children.name: Text
children.value: Select the Trading Post blueprint in the desired location and give the order to build it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Sail in any direction to discover new islands to settle.

children.name: Text
children.value: Select the Trading Post blueprint once you are ready to place it.

children.name: Text
children.value: This is your construction menu. You can select your marketplace, residences, roads and everything you need.

children.name: Text
children.value: Start with a marketplace. As the heart of your city, it needs to be placed in an open space, so your people can live around it.

children.name: Text
children.value: Nobody will be able to reach your marketplace until you build a road to connect it to your trading post.

children.name: Text
children.value: Housing people is essential! Make sure to build their residences near the marketplace and connect them via roads so people have access to goods.

children.name: Text
children.value: You can select the Farmer Residences, Marketplace and Roads from the Construction Menu.

children.name: Text
children.value: Your people need to live near the marketplace, otherwise they will not move in.

children.name: Text
children.value: People will only be able to reach your marketplace if a road connects it to your trading post.

children.name: Text
children.value: All residences need to have a marketplace nearby. Else, no one will move in!

children.name: Text
children.value: Residences need to be connected to a nearby marketplace by a road.

children.name: Text
children.value: Residences need a marketplace nearby. You can select it from your construction menu.

children.name: Text
children.value: You can drag and drop to lay down roads after selecting them on the construction menu. You can also click on the starting point and a second time when you want to place it.
